snippet: While many analysts expected Apple to price the iPhone 5C at about $400, it will actually go for significantly more in China, where the company is struggling.
abstract: Apple, with introduction of its iPhone 5C, takes step toward catering to China, world's largest smartphone market and one that is crucial to company's future; more than $700 price of phone in country, however, will still keep Apple's phones beyond reach of most Chinese consumers; firm needs to reach deal with cellphone carrier China Mobile.

byline.original: By BRIAN X. CHEN and ERIC PFANNER

lead_paragraph: While many analysts expected Apple to price the iPhone 5C at about $400, it will actually go for significantly more in China, where the company is struggling.

headline.main: Cheaper iPhone Will Cost More in China
headline.print_headline: Cheaper iPhone Will Cost More in China
